results.title: Just us
results.brief_description: Karli and Elmo grew up together. They went to the same schools, shared good times and bad times, and when things went wrong, there was always each other.

results.title: Just the job
results.creator_credit: Jenny Day, Soerabaia Pictures and Ron Saunders
results.brief_description: Designed as an aid for those who are about to leave school and try for a place in the work force. Outlines the kind of trade and post-trade courses available, as well as basic apprenticeship courses and development courses for various skills. Explains the need to find out as much as possible about a job, to ask questions, and talk to teachers.

results.title: Just swimming
results.creator_credit: Tom Williamson, New Zealand National Film Unit and John Cooper
results.brief_description: A motivational film showing the variety of water activities that can be enjoyed once the skills of swimming have been acquired. Features scuba diving, water ballet, water hockey and basketball, competitive swimming, surfing and marathon swimming.

results.title: Just smile and shine
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Anna Huynh and ACMI
results.brief_description: Anna Huynh tells of how she learned the hard way the pitfalls of trying to fit in. Looking different to everyone else, she tried doing everything her peers were doing and it took her further away from herself. In being true to herself, she discovered the true friendship and, ultimately, her true self.

results.title: Just say no
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Christiana Dumitru and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Christiana Dumitru’s father died and her family had to move, she turned to a partying lifestyle. Hooked on drugs at an alarmingly young age, Dumitru reflects on the strength of will she had to summon to get back on track and the friends and family she has learnt to value.

results.title: Just Peanuts
results.brief_description: In Australia, peanuts are grown at Kingaroy, Queensland. The film shows how they reach down from the stalks to grow under the soil, how they are harvested and left to dry in the hot sun. The many uses of peanuts are illustrated, including the surprising number of by-products such as fabrics, coffee substitute, cosmetics and high quality soap.

results.title: Just Part Of the Job
results.creator_credit: Kim Windsor, Victorian Unemployed Workers' Union and Evan Keddie
results.brief_description: Designed to stimulate discussion regarding sexual harassment. Shows a school leaver and her efforts to find a job. Presents the difficult situation she finds herself in when she is subject to a rather subtle form of sexual harassment in an employment interview.

results.title: Just Out of Reach
results.brief_description: A portrayal of a young woman’s conflict with an unresponsive world. Cath is rushed to hospital after a suicide attempt and the film traces back to her adolescence to reveal what has led to a despair so severe that suicide appears to be her only option. Her conflicts with her family, principally with her father, are later identified in her relationship with her husband. Each leads her to attempt suicide. Both attempts are the result of her utter despair at the loss of the love of the person who matters the most to her.
